data.title: Jeff Bezos: Facial recognition ‘a perfect example’ of the need for regulation, and Amazon is working on it
data.text: Jeff Bezos made a surprise appearance at an Amazon press reception Wednesday evening to introduce singer-songwriter Charlie Puth to the crowd — but before he made his way to the stage, the Amazon CEO made some unexpected news on the issue of regulating facial recognition.

data.title: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos says his company is working on face recognition regulations
data.text: Amazon.com Inc Chief Executive Jeff Bezos said the company's public policy team is working on proposed regulations around facial recognition, a fledgling technology that has drawn criticism of the technology giant's cloud computing unit.

data.title: Everything Amazon announced at its Alexa event today
data.text: As is now typical just ahead of the holidays, Amazon just inundated us with a whole new lineup of hardware devices, including new Echo smart speakers and screens, at its Alexa event today, plus other smart home and connected devices from its brands Ring and eero. There were also a slew of surprises, like Alexa […]

data.title: Amazon's new Echo lineup 2019
data.text: Amazon announced a total of 15 new products today, and while the Echo Buds, Echo Frames, and Echo Studio are the main attractions, it also refreshed or released new products across its Echo product line.

data.title: Amazon announces privacy updates as its devices expand deeper into the home
data.text: Amazon has announced a new lineup of Echo devices and a slew of privacy updates for existing products, as the company expands further into consumers’ lives.

data.title: Amazon's New Alexa-Driven Devices Give Customers the Privacy They Want, SVP Limp Says
data.text: Dave Limp, Amazon.com Inc. senior vice president of devices and services, discusses Amazon's launch of a high-end speaker, the Echo Studio, and new Alexa-driven devices with Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs on "Bloomberg Technology."

data.title: Here Are All the Gadgets Amazon Announced Today
data.text: The e-commerce juggernaut showed off a staggering number of new products.

data.title: Hands on Amazon's new high-end Echo Studio speaker
data.text: We take a look at ALL amazon's hardware and speakers just announced, but for this video we are focused in on the Echo Studio. The Echo Studio is a voice assistant with Alexa capability, sure, but more importantly its a high-end speaker with full dolby atmos sound (even surround sound capability), and deep bass.

data.title: Amazon Wants Alexa to Move (With You) Far Beyond the Living Room
data.text: New devices were introduced on Wednesday to get the digital assistant in your earbuds, in your eyeglasses and in your bathroom.

data.title: Ears-on with Amazon’s new Echo earbuds, framebuds, and ringbud
data.text: Amazon announced more than a few devices today during an event at its headquarters in Seattle, and it was the smallest gadgets that made the biggest impression. The company built Alexa into earbuds, glasses, and a ring with the Echo Buds, Echo Frames, and Echo Loop.

data.title: Echo Frames First Impressions: the new alexa-enabled smart glasses
data.text: Amazon just announced a new pair of Alexa-enabled smart eye glasses.

data.title: Is Amazon’s Alexa ready to leave home and become a wearable voice assistant?
data.text: Amazon’s device event today played host to a dizzying number of product announcements, of all stripes – but notably, there are three brand new ways to wear Alexa on your body. Amazon clearly wants to give you plenty of options to take Alexa with you when you leave the house, the only place it’s really […]

data.title: A first look at Amazon's new AirPods competitor, smart glasses and ring
data.text: The Echo Buds, Loop and Frames show that Amazon wants to put its Alexa smart assistant literally everywhere: in your ears, on your hand and on your face They all seem neat, but I'm a little skeptical on why they need to exist.

data.title: Amazon's Echo Buds hands-on first impressions
data.text: Amazon just announced a new pair of in-ear wireless bluetooth earbuds called the Echo buds, with full voice-activated functionality.

data.title: Amazon debuts Alexa-powered wireless Echo earbuds
data.text: Amazon unveiled several new Echo devices and Alexa features at its annual hardware event on Wednesday.

data.title: GM, Amazon partner to install Alexa voice assistant in cars
data.text: The popular voice assistant will be available on model year 2018 and newer Buick, Cadillac, Chevrolet and GMC vehicles with compatible infotainment systems in the first half of next year.

data.title: Amazon brings Samuel L. Jackson's voice to Alexa and announces voice-controlled glasses
data.text: Amazon.com Inc  on Wednesday said actor Samuel L. Jackson and other celebrities will voice speech for the company's virtual assistant Alexa, while the voice aid will also be built into a new wearable line of earbuds, eyeglasses and a ring.

data.title: Has Amazon Bigfooted Teladoc?
data.text: When Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) spots an opportunity to muscle in on a new sector, it generally launches its assault on a lot of different fronts.

data.title: E-commerce Remains Strong, and Amazon Stock Is in the Buy Zone
data.text:
Owning AMZN stock will provide direct exposure as e-commerce continues its steady expansion.

data.title: Echo Loop puts Amazon's Alexa on your finger
data.text: Alexa's newest proposal is to put its smart assistant on your finger as a ring.

data.title: Echo Glow: Amazon announces a new $30 color-changing light for kids
data.text: The company debuts a new light the little ones will likely enjoy.

data.title: Every Echo product Amazon just announced in 10 minutes
data.text: Amazon took the stage at their annual showing of upcoming products.

data.title: New Amazon Products Include High-End Speakers, Security Controls
data.text:
Amazon unveiled a series of products, including new and updated versions of its line of smart speakers and new versions of its video-based devices, at the company's annual hardware event.
The post New Amazon Products Include High-End Speakers, Security Controls appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

data.title: Amazon introduces new Echo devices, Alexa features and a smart oven
data.text: Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, +1.27% unveiled a slew of new devices and features at a Wednesday event, including a smart oven.

data.title: Amazon’s new Echo Frames smart glasses will cost $179.99
data.text: Amazon's smart glasses are only 31 grams.

data.title: Amazon unveils new Alexa-powered Echo Buds, undercuts Apple’s AirPods with $129.99 price tag
data.text: Amazon is taking on Apple with its own wireless earbuds called the Echo Buds, powered by Alexa voice technology and priced at $129.

data.title: Amazon wants to put microphones into your rings and glasses
data.text: At the end of its hardware event today, Amazon announced a new program for testing and selling its own experimental, limited-volume hardware: Day 1 Editions. The first of these new products is Echo Frames.

data.title: Amazon Smart Oven is the Alexa-compatible appliance you didn’t know you needed in 2019
data.text: Amazon Smart Oven will making cooking easier

data.title: Amazon Takes Another Big Step Toward Getting Into Healthcare
data.text: The tech giant recently launched its own virtual and in-person clinic. Here's why it could be a game-changer.

data.title: Amazon Sidewalk is a new long-range wireless network for your stuff
data.text: At its annual hardware event in Seattle, Amazon today announced Sidewalk, a new low-bandwidth, long-distance wireless protocol the company is developing to connect all of the IoT devices in and around your house. Amazon argues that Bluetooth and WiFi don’t have enough range, while 5F takes too much power and is too complex.

data.title: Amazon’s Echo Buds bring Alexa to your earholes
data.text: Amazon had a lot of surprises at this morning’s big event in Seattle. This one, however, we saw coming from a mile away.

data.title: Amazon Sidewalk extends Wi-Fi and Bluetooth outside your house to control more gadgets
data.text: The network will help you use smart gadgets outside your home.

data.title: Amazon and Discovery cook up ‘Food Network Kitchen,’ a streaming service aimed at home chefs
data.text: Discovery and Amazon think they have the right ingredients to get food lovers to subscribe to yet another streaming service.

data.title: How Amazon is closing out competitors by opening up voice
data.text: We’ve come a long way with voice-based interfaces in the last several years: They can find and play the music you like, tell you jokes, set timers, control your lights and help you shop, among many other things. But the battle lines were drawn from the start when it came to territory.

data.title: Amazon introduces an Alexa-compatible smart oven
data.text: The Alexa microwave admittedly seemed a bit goofy when Amazon introduced it at an event this time last year. But low cost coupled with the company’s built-in promotional machine have made it the best selling microwave on the site — that’s no small feat.

data.title: All the new Alexa products at Amazon's big 2019 event
data.text: Amazon announced a slew of new products at its yearly press event. Read on to see everything the company had on display.

data.title: Allbirds CEO Joey Zwillinger on Amazon's new competitive shoe
data.text: Allbirds CEO Joey Zwillinger joins "Squawk Alley" to discuss Amazon's new wool shoe poised to take on the company.

data.title: Amazon unveils new Echo clock and Alexa privacy features
data.text: Amazon kicked off its big media event on Wednesday by introducing new features for its popular Alexa voice assistant, including an option to auto delete voice recordings in an apparent attempt to address recent privacy concerns.

data.title: Alexa's "Certified for Humans" wants to eliminate smart home headaches
data.text: Amazon wants you to be able to set up your smart home even if you don't know anything about tech.

data.title: Amazon’s new Alexa Food Network service aims to make Echo the Peloton of cooking
data.text: Amazon is partnering up with Food Network on a new recipe service for its Echo Show line of devices, borne out of the interest it saw in users for recipes and cooking videos on the smart video speaker. The new Food Network Kitchen service, which is launching in October, will be available on phones and […]

data.title: Amazon introduces Echo Glow light
data.text: The company debuted a new light the whole family can enjoy.

data.title: Discovery Teams With Amazon On Food Network Subscription Streaming Offering
data.text: Discovery, whose approach to streaming in the U.S. has favored participation in bundled offerings over direct-to-consumer fare, is taking a different tack with the launch of Food Network Kitchen in partnership with Amazon. Billing it as a “first-of-its-kind” service to launch in late October, Discovery said it will offer 25 live, weekly, interactive cooking classes

data.title: Amazon adds an 8-inch Echo Show, priced at $129
data.text: Starting today, there really is an Echo Show for every need. In amongst this morning’s deluge of Alexa hardware, Amazon announced yet another version of the smart screen.

data.title: Echo Show 8: Amazon announces a new $130 touchscreen smart display
data.text: The company also introduced the Food Network's new Alexa-powered video recipe service.

data.title: Amazon unveils the $199 Echo Studio, its answer to the Apple HomePod and Google Home Max
data.text: Today at a special event Amazon unveiled a bevy of new Echo devices including several aimed a bit upmarket.  The Echo Studio is Amazon’s answer to the Google Nest Max and Apple HomePod.

data.title: Amazon refreshes the Echo with improved sound
data.text: Amazon’s just getting started with the new hardware this morning. In addition to the Echo Dot With Clock (which, as mentioned, is an Echo Dot that has a Clock), the company refreshed the baseline Echo.

data.title: Amazon event 2019: Echo Studio, Alexa Frustration Detection and everything announced so far
data.text: "Alexa, how many chicken thighs do I need? "

data.title: Amazon launches multilingual mode for using Alexa in multiple languages at once
data.text: Amazon is launching multilingual mode for its Alexa-supporting devices, the company announced today at its Devices event in Seattle. The new multilingual mode will initially be available in the U.S.

data.title: Samuel L. Jackson's voice comes to Amazon devices
data.text: Say Alexa again.

data.title: Amazon announces new 'Home Mode' privacy feature for Ring doorbells
data.text: The video doorbells won't record when owners are home, if they want it that way.
